text:
Here to share his tale of woe
is the tight end

with a tight end --
from the Kansas City Chiefs,

it's the Super Bowl champion,
Travis Kelce!
[ Cheering and applause ]

What's going on?
What's going on?

Travis, why don't you
take it away?

All right, Jameela, this is --
so, this is my misery story.

So before every NFL draft,
there's a the NFL Combine

and all the top prospects
either go to the Combine

or they have a pro day,
which is the exact same thing

as the Combine,
it's just at your school.

As soon as I walked on campus,
it just wasn't good for me.
I mean, my stomach's aching.
I feel sick to my stomach --

it has something to do with,
like,

either the nerves
of this big day

or the mound of sushi
I had the night before

that was just laying underneath
the egg and sausage burrito
that I had that morning.

So as soon
as I started stretching,

I'm just projectile
vomiting across the field,
just showing these scouts,

you know,
I'm ready for the moment.

Ow, wow!
All my friends

are looking at me, just like,
"Dude, you all right?!

You okay?"
And I'm just like,

"Yeah, you know... just fighting
the good fight, man --"

[ Laughter ]
You know?

So I go through
a few of the drills

and I finally get
to the 40 yard dash
and I'm like, in my mind,

the 40 yard dash in the NFL
is huge.

It's like the biggest thing that
they judge you on coming out.

So it's my last hope that if
I have a good 40 time,

at least these scouts
and coaches

can go back to their teams
with something positive.

Yeah.
So I get up to the line, man.

I'm -- in my mind, I'm like,
"Just be strong,

just be explosive,
and get out of the break."

-"Explosive"!
-So the instant I move,
boom!
Right out the other end.

And it was
double trouble,

double whammy,
there's nothing more awkward
than shaking a man's hand

in a job interview
with puke breath

and Lord knows how much burrito
is in your pants.
[ Laughter and applause ]

And no one knew until now.
-Wow.

Travis, thank you so much
for honoring us

with that secret story
of yours.

We love you!
-Sydney, Abby, good luck!

Travis, we won't
tell anyone!

Okay, so now, for $2,000,
talk it through and lock in

where you think "You Crap Out
During Your Big Interview:
lands on the Misery Index.
[ Whispering indistinctly ]

Is it traumatic,
emotionally?
I think it is.

I mean, if you didn't
get the job, maybe?
All right, everyone,

I'm gonna need you to lock in
your answers!

So everyone is locked in,
let's see who has mastered

the misery by being the closest
to the correct answer.
Sydney, you have locked in at...
[ Sydney groaning ]

Forty-one -- now let's see
where Abby has locked in.

Forty-six!
I think we got this.

Okay, let's see
what our shrinks say.
Good luck.
[ Cheering and applause ]
[ Bell ringing ]
Sixty, oh, my goodness!

So, Abby wins,
which means, unfortunately,
